record.description: Kenneth A. Rouse, vice-president in charge of personnel and public relations for the A. B. Dick Company, has been named Chicago area chairman of the Alumni Division of the University of Chicago campaign. The campaign seeks to raise $32,700,000 by June 1958, for university improvement projects over the next ten years. Mr. Rouse was Class of 1928 president, and as captain of the university's football team, he was named most valuable player.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
